intro: Mitrasacme epigaea, commonly known as the eastern starwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. The plant features small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by distinctive, three-lobed leaves. Its root system is fibrous and helps stabilize soil in its natural habitat. Botanically, it belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits.
